ARABIC: وَلَوْلَآ أَن ثَبَّتْنَٰكَ لَقَدْ كِدتَّ تَرْكَنُ إِلَيْهِمْ شَيْـًٔا قَلِيلًا

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: If We had not made you firm, you would have leaned towards them a little.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: If We had not kept you constant you had almost leaned towards them.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: Indeed, had We not strengthened you, you might have inclined to them a little,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: Had We not strengthened your faith you might have relied on them some how.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: And had We not kept you steadfast, possibly you might have inclined to them just a little.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: And had We not made you stand firm, you would nearly have inclined to them a little.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And had it not been that We had already established you, you would certainly have been near to incline to them a little;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: and had We not confirmed thee, surely thou wert near to inclining unto them a very little;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: And if We had not made thee wholly firm thou mightest almost have inclined unto them a little.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: If We had not made you stand firm, you would almost have inclined towards them a little.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: And were it not that We had confirmed thee, thou hadst well-nigh leaned toward them a little.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: And had We not fortified you, certainly you might have inclined toward them a bit.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: And had We not given thee strength, thou wouldst nearly have inclined to them a little.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: And had We not made you stand firm, you would nearly have inclined to them a little.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: and if We had not fortified you, you would have been very slightly inclining towards them;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Had We not given you stability, you might have inclined towards them a little.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And if We had not strengthened you, you would have almost inclined to them a little.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [17:74] And if We had not made you [stand] firm, upon the Truth, by way of [divine] protection (‘isma), certainly you might have, you nearly, inclined to them a little, because of the extent of their deception and their persistence. This [statement] is explicit about the fact that the Prophet (s) neither inclined nor came close to doing so.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (And if We had not made thee wholly firm) if We had not protected and preserved you (thou mightest almost have inclined unto them a little) regarding that which they requested from you.
